"OPEN COMMUNITY FORUM"
Offers the poor the opportunity to become "active
participants" in a group setting, in the process
of airing the problems of poverty and discussing,
with recognized community leadership, the methods,
the programs through which to overcome poverty
and disadvantage at the community level. In such
programs people can give voice to some of their
feelings, and through them also, find some stimulus
which can, if sustained, affect their lives. Some
subject areas might be:
What Can We Do About Inadequate Housing in
Our Community?
What Can We Do About The Lack of Adequate
Medical Facilities in Our Community?
What Can We Do About Upgrading Education And
Improving The Schools In Our Community?
